topic: How to document REST APIs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document REST APIs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Documenting REST APIs using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to effectively document your REST APIs using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. This guide will cover key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python.
FastAPI provides automatic API documentation using OpenAPI/Swagger specifications.
FastAPI supports multiple programming paradigms including AsyncIO and standard Python syntax.
FastAPI has robust type validation and supports request validation, response serialization, and more.
version_notes: FastAPI version 0.72.0 and above supports Python 3.12.
Ensure you have updated your FastAPI installation to the latest stable version for optimal results.
caveats: Some features like GraphQL, SocketIO, and File uploads are not natively supported by FastAPI but can be achieved through extensions.
While FastAPI supports Python 3.7+, using the latest Python version (3.12) is recommended for best performance.
